title: Ticket #3335: condor_q analysis improvements for 7.9 series
description: Master ticket for changes related to improvements to condor_q -analyze and -better-analyze for the 7.9 series. See attached design document.
remarks:
2013-Mar-05 10:58:27 by johnkn:
Bulk change of target version from v070904 to v070905 using ./ticket-target-mover.
2013-Apr-22 11:10:10 by johnkn:
Bulk change of target version from v070905 to v070906 using ./ticket-target-mover.

2013-May-21 14:46:36 by smoler:
Info from TJ about where condor_q ended up.

Usage: 

    [general-opts] are
        -global                 Query all Schedulers in this pool
        -submitter <submitter>  Get queue of specific submitter
        -name <name>            Name of Scheduler
        -pool <host>            Use host as the central manager to query
        -jobads <file>          Read queue from a file of job ClassAds
        -userlog <file>         Read queue from a user log file
        -constraint <expr>      Add constraint on job ClassAds
    [restriction-list] each restriction may be one of
        <cluster>               Get information about specific cluster
        <cluster>.<proc>        Get information about specific job
        <owner>                 Information about jobs owned by <owner>
    [output-opts] are
        -cputime                Display CPU_TIME instead of RUN_TIME
        -currentrun             Display times only for current run
        -debug                  Display debugging info to console
        -dag                    Sort DAG jobs under their DAGMan
        -expert                 Display shorter error messages
        -globus                 Get information about jobs of type globus
        -goodput                Display job goodput statistics
        -help [Universe|State]  Display this screen, JobUniverses, JobStates
        -hold                   Get information about jobs on hold
        -io                     Show information regarding I/O
        -run                    Get information about running jobs
        -stream-results         Produce output as jobs are fetched
        -version                Print the Condor Version and exit
        -wide                   Widescreen output
        -autoformat[:V,ntlh] <attr> [attr2 [attr3 ...]]
                                Print attr(s) with automatic formatting
        -format <fmt> <attr>    Print attribute attr using format fmt
        -long                   Display entire ClassAds
        -xml                    Display entire ClassAds, but in XML
        -attributes X,Y,...     Attributes to show in -xml and -long
    [analyze-opts] are
        -analyze[:<qual>]       Perform matchmaking analysis on jobs
        -better-analyze[:<qual>]        Perform more detailed match analysis
            <qual> is a comma separated list of one or more of
            priority    Consider user priority during analysis
            summary     Show a one-line summary for each job or machine
            reverse     Analyze machines rather than jobs
        -machine <name>         Machine name or slot name for analysis
        -mconstraint <expr>     Machine constraint for analysis
        -slotads <file>         Read Machine ClassAds for analysis from <file>
                                <file> can be the output of condor_status -long
        -userprios <file>       Read user priorities for analysis from <file>
                                <file> can be the output of condor_userprio -l
        -nouserprios            Don't consider user priority during analysis
        -reverse                Analyze Machine requirements against jobs
        -verbose                Show progress and machine names in results

What's new from 7.8 series: 

  -jobads,  -userlog, <qual> on -analyze and -better-analyze, -machine,
  -mconstraint, -slotads, -userprios, -nouserprios, -reverse, -verbose,
  -autoformat

-jobads <file> reads job classads from a file rather than from the schedd. this file can be the output of condor_q -long.

-userlog <file> - reads job classads from a user/job log rather than the schedd. only a few fields of the job ad can be read from the userlog, but this is sufficient to determine the job status, and avoids loading the schedd when polling to see if the job has started or completed.

-machine <slot_or_machine_name> - analyze only this slot or machine, rather than the whole pool. use only one of -machine or -mconstraint.

-mconstraint <expr> - analyze only slots that match this expression, rather than the whole pool. may also be specified as -slotconstraint. use only one of either -machine or -mconstraint.

-slotads <file> - read slot/machine ads from a file rather than the collector. this file can be the output of condor_status -long.

-userprios <file> - read user priorities from a file rather than from the negotiator. this file can be the output of condor_userprio -long. this option forces the priority qualifier for -analyze and -better.

-nouserprios - analyze without considering user priority, this is now the default unless -userprios <file> is specified or the priority qualifier is passed to -analyze or -better.

-reverse - another way to specify reverse analyze, see -analyze:reverse.

-verbose - include additional information about the progress of analyze and the names of machines that matched or did not match. not all machine names are output, the limit is about 1k.

-analyze and -better-analyze now have optional qualifiers, one or more qualifiers may be specified, comma or : separated, without spaces. Like this -analyze:summary,reverse. qualifiers may be abbreviated sum, rev & pri.

priority - consider user priority when doing analysis. this will fetch priorities from the negotiator unless -userprios <file> is also specified. Fetching user priorities from the negotiator may take a few minutes - it may wait until the negotiation cycle has ended.

reverse - analyze slot (machine) Requirements and START expression against jobs. (default is job Requirements against machines).

summary - print one line per job (or machine if used with reverse).

Sample output is: 

[johnkn@submit-1 ~]$ condor_q -analyze:summary

-- Submitter: submit-1.chtc.wisc.edu : <128.104.100.43:9618?sock=11794_95bb_3> : submit-1.chtc.wisc.edu
Analyzing matches for 5979 slots
               Autocluster    Matches     Machine     Running Serving
 JobId        Members/Idle Requirements Rejects Job  Users Job Other User Available Owner
------------- ------------ ------------ ----------- ----------- ---------- --------- -----
25764522.0    7/0                  5910         820 7/10       5046        34 cehall
25764682.0    9/0                  2172         603 9/9       1531        29 cehall
25765082.0    18/0                 2172         603 18/9       1531        29 cehall
25765900.0    1/0                  2172         603 1/9       1531        29 cehall



[johnkn@submit-1 ~]$ condor_q -ana:sum,rev


-- Submitter: submit-1.chtc.wisc.edu : <128.104.100.43:9618?sock=11794_95bb_3> : submit-1.chtc.wisc.edu
Analyzing matches for 2885 jobs
                                    Slot  Slot's Req    Job's Req     Both
Name                                Type  Matches Job Matches Slot    Match %
------------------------            ---- ------------ ------------ ----------
slot1@INFO-LSS-D037-W.ad.wisc.edu   Stat         2729 0       0.00
slot2@INFO-LSS-D037-W.ad.wisc.edu   Stat         2729 0       0.00
slot1@aci-001.chtc.wisc.edu         Part            0 2793       0.00
slot1_1@aci-001.chtc.wisc.edu       Dyn          2644 2792      91.37
slot1_2@aci-001.chtc.wisc.edu       Dyn          2623 2601      85.10
slot1_3@aci-001.chtc.wisc.edu       Dyn          2644 2632      85.82
slot1_4@aci-001.chtc.wisc.edu       Dyn          2644 2792      91.37
slot1@aci-002.chtc.wisc.edu         Part            0 2633       0.00
slot1_10@aci-002.chtc.wisc.edu      Dyn          2623 2601      85.10
derived_tickets:
#3302   condor_q -analyze takes a long time in chtc pool
#3413   condor_q shows jobs grouped by dag even when -dag is not specified.
#3414   condor_q should be able to analyze machine START expressions
#3416   condor_q analyze doesn't handle complex requirements.
#3653   examples showing condor_q -analyze need updating
